content:
re :When I highlight a contact and click "Add to to",

I presume you have clicked on 'New Message' button and are wanting to compose an email. The comment relates to the 'Contacts Sidebar'.

When you select a contact from the list in the Contact side bar - are the buttons eg: 'Add to to' enabled or not ?


re : Only "collected addresses" will populate the address box.

On laptop - where did you get the Thunderbird installation ? Microsoft App Store or via the official website : https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/

I'm wondering if all your profiles - maybe copied over from desktop to laptop were put in the default location used if you downloaded from Thunderbird website, but if you used Microsoft app store then they stick the profile in a completely different location, so it's got all the Collected but cannot see anything in other address books.

Normally uninstalling does not solve anything, but in this case, if you used the Microsoft app store to install Thunderbird and you copied all your data into the default location for a normal Thunderbird install then I would say uninstall and then reinstall same version as used on desktop. Make sure to check whether you used ESR on desktop and then make sure to select the channel for 'Thunderbird Extended Support Release' to get download.

Try uninstall Thunderbird and get a fresh download from the offical website which should install and pick up the profile you copied and set up in the default location eg: C://Users/username/Appdata/Thunderbird.....
creator: Toad-Hall

creator: flyfishr

content:
Assuming you want exactly the same on both desktop and laptop. Assuming same version on both computers and using same default location for profile. Image included as a guide.

On desktop:

  • Exit Thunderbird if running
  • In Windows search type: %Appdata%
  • Select %Appdata% File folder
  • Select 'Roaming' folder
  • Copy the 'Thunderbird' folder to external device - it contains everything.

On laptop: It will have the new installed Thunderbird - same version as on Desktop.

  • Exit Thunderbird if running
  • In Windows search type: %Appdata%
  • Select %Appdata% File folder
  • Select 'Roaming' folder
  • Delete the default 'Thunderbird' folder
  • Paste the copied 'Thunderbird' folder from external device into the 'Roaming' folder.

Start Thunderbird - you should see identical of everything that is on desktop.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Are you downloading emails into a pop or imap account? When you filter the email where is it going - into a folder in same account or into another account? If other account - Is the other account a pop or imap or the 'Local Folders' account? Where is the affected folder ?

Can you post an image of the filter so I see whether it's just being copied or moved to or whether it's also being deleted or a tag applied etc ?

In 'Message Filters' click on 'Filter Log' button. Is the Filter Log enabled ? Can you see what it has been filtering ? If no - not enabled then enable it now as it's useful for future reference. If yes, scroll down to the last filtered email that used that filter to put in the affected folder. Post an image of what it says.

Do you download full copies?

If this is an imap account: In Account Settings > Synchronisation & Storage for the account Click on 'Advanced' button Is the 'affected folder' listed ? Has it's checkbox been selected to ensure a full copy download into that folder?

creator: detectivekounan

content:
OK so email looks like it comes via Salesforce Marketing Cloud marketing servers Filter using: Filter before junk classification Match all the following From contains <system@email address> Perform these actions Move message to: 'System' folder on mail account name Where 'System' folder is a subfolder to the Inbox

All seems ok at this point - I did wonder if you were moving before or after junk classification. The info supplied answered that query. I notice the email came from a xt.local server and sometimes anti-spam server filters may pick up on emails using a marketing server and mark them as spam.

If you downloaded headers and then server moved or removed email from the server Inbox for some reason, then when selected to open it could not retrieve the rest from server.

It's also possible you have Anti-Virus product scanning incoming mail and maybe it does not like the email, so removed it.

Info also tells me the destination of the move is to a subfolder of the Inbox rather than a normal top level folder in pop account.

Test - do emails open if in the Inbox folder. Please disable that System@sort filter and allow those emails to arrive in Inbox. Are you able to open and read those emails when arriving in Inbox?

>>Do you download full copies? > Sorry. I'm not sure about this.

In 'Account Settings'

  • Select 'Server Settings' for the pop account
  • Q: Is the checkbox 'Fetch Headers only' selected or not ?
  • Q: Is the checkbox selected 'Leave messages on server' ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
You can't change from POP to IMAP by just changing the settings. The account has to be added as a new IMAP account:

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Convert_a_POP_account_to_a_IMAP_account

Copy the POP Inbox to Local Folders, if messages aren't kept on the server after download, and copy any POP subfolders to Local Folders, add the account as IMAP, then remove the POP account.

content: Thanks for the reply. I would assume you would have to do the same thing on your phones pop account? I would have to create and configure a new imap account and delete the old pop account?

Most mail apps on phones default to IMAP, unless you explicitly set it up as POP. Look at the folder structure, as POP only downloads the Inbox, not other folders you normally see in webmail , such as Spam.

content:
There are many ways to delete an email and I'm none the wiser on what you are doing, so I'll offer a list of various methods. Please note: do not attempt to delete or indeed do anything whilst Thunderbird is compacting - wait until it has finished.

  1. Select email in list so it is open and you can read it in Message Pane - click on the 'Delete' button in the Message Header area.
  2. Right click on email in Message List and click on the Trash bin icon located top right
  3. Select email in list and use the Menu Bar toolbar - select 'Edit' > click on 'Delete Message'
  4. Select email in list and use Menu bar via keyboard 'Alt E' and then 'D'
  5. Select email in list and press the 'Delete' key on keyboard.
  6. In Table View - Enable the 'Delete' column header so you see a grey trash bin icon adjacent to each email in list - click on the relevant bin icon to delete message.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Please do not hide server name settings as they are vital. They are not personal data and most server settings are used by hundreds of thousands of people and are checkable on the internet. The important part that does need to be erased is the first part of username - the bit before the '@' in email address needs to be erased.

You say Thunderbird is newly installed, so maybe your Firewall is causing the problem.

Check Firewall

  • Exit Thunderbird
  • Access Firewall
  • Set up thunderbird.exe as an allowed program, otherwise it may block access to internet.

Pop account using port 110 is not exactly secure.

Usually a secure Port used for pop is: 995 Connection Security: SSL/TLS Authentication Method :Normal Password.

content:
Please remember this is a public forum and you should never post any personal data.

All replies are sent via a type of email bot - when a comment is posted it is auto sent via the forum email to whatever email address you used when setting up the mozilla account. People who post comments have no control over what email address is used. No one from Thunderbird nor community helpers etc will ever telephone anyone.

So if you get responses from people telephoning you then beware they are not people from this Thunderbird forum community. Likewise if you get emails not sent to the email address you used in creating the Mozilla account then it's not from this forum.

re :A fault notification comes up advising incorrect username or password.

That means Thunderbird attempted to access server using the server settings you set up and the server responded with a fault notification. It means: Either password is wrong for that username OR password is correct but not for that username OR both password and username are incorrect OR server setting are not correct regardless of whether password or username are correct or not.

I've just checked your forum profile and notice you have had an issue for a wile, but you seem confused.

I have changed my password through your system but neither my new, or previous, passwords allow me access. You can only set/modify a password via the webmail account of the relevant server accessed using a browser. Then you can edit the stored password in Thunderbird to match it. You cannot simply change a password in Thunderbird and expect it to work unless you have already modified the password in the webmail account.

Alternatively, please transfer my account back to Heart Internet, or another operator that will provide me with continuous access to my emails. Heart Internet is a provider of domain names, webhosting and virtual private servers and you seem to have transfered to CloudTech24. Thunderbird is not a server nor an operator nor a provider of domain names, etc - it is just an email client program running on your computer which faciliates accessing various mail accounts all in one location, so you do not need to logon to various web accounts.

Judging by the comment: I was issued with information sheets headed, "CloudTech24 Email Setup on Laptop with Thunderbird"

I presume you have a business email account with CloudTech24. They offer Microsoft account and Gmail Workspace accounts etc.

I notice in another question you mentioned a hotmail address, so that means I know you have a Microsoft Account. Did you set up the business account to use the Microsoft server ? Is your business email address on an office365 server ? At tihs point I'm assuming this might be the case. Logon to the Microsoft Account webmail account- Can you see the business email address listed ? Is should be listed as an alias account along with the hotmail email address.

All accounts in a Microsoft account are seen as 'alias' accounts by Microsoft. All email addresses in the Microsoft account must use the same password as the Microsoft account - so please make sure that is set up correctly. Also email clients use SMTP to send mail - Microsoft only allow people to send using whatever account is set up as the 'Primary' account. You can choose the 'Primary ' account, but if you use hotmail as primary then all emails must be sent via hotmail address - but in Thunderbird you can set a Reply-to to use the business account. What account is set up as primary - business or hotmail ?


I need to know what server settings they advised you to use. Please post the following information so we can check on the basic server settings. In Thunderbird Help > Troubleshooting Information Scroll down to 'Mail and News Accounts' setion Copy all the data in that section and paste into this forum question - do not start another question. Alternative - post an image showing that data.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
dannas said
After 30 years of using Thunderbird with no problems, yesterday opened my account (with my wife's email also) and everything was gone.

Which was the Thunderbird startup page you saw when "everything was gone"? Did Thunderbird ask to "set up your existing email address" (see image)? I think that the prefs.js file in your Thunderbird profile might be broken.

In Thunderbird go to Help > Troubleshooting Information > Profile Folder > Open Folder... and quit Thunderbird. In the profile folder search for prefs-1.js or an invalidprefs.js file. If you don't find neither of those files look for a prefs.js file with an actuel creation date and look up its size. If the size is between 6 and 8 kB it's an new virgin prefs.js file which doesn't contain your account data.

Do you have an antivirus software, other than Windows Defender, that may be interfering in your mail? Random loss of messages for one email account is very remote for a server. You might also check any filters that you have. There are some on the forum that may have more in-depth ideas to share.

content: Die .msf-bestanden zijn eigenlijk een soort indexeerbestanden en bevatten niet daadwerkelijk de e-mailberichten, die staan in het bestand zonder een extensie, 2000.msf hoort dus bij 2000. Als je het .msf-bestand verwijdert, dan wordt bij opnieuw starten van Thunderbird een nieuw .msf-bestand aangemaakt. Deze truc gebruiken we wel eens als een map corrupt is geraakt. Maar hier lijkt het andersom te gaan en dat is niet logisch. Om een map ‘2000&AAk-Canada’ te tonen verwacht ik ook een bestand met die naam in de profielmap. Kan het zijn dat niet alle bestanden en mappen zichtbaar zijn in Windows? Klik daarvoor op ‘Weergave’ en dan ‘Verborgen items’.

content:
- click settings>privcacy&security then click savedpasswords and then click showpasswords - when transferring to new pC, the simplest approach is to copy/paste the entire profile - and that will automatically include passwords Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: - one option is to highlight all in message list pane and then press delete key - another option is to click edit>select>all and then press delete key
creator: davidsk

content: R-click on the attachment you want to download > Save as .... (image "save as") )will open a dialogue window in the Finder. Choose the destination folder and click on "Save". (image "save "attachment"))
